title: Provide suggestion for use after move caused by match expression

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-papercut
labels.description: Diagnostic error that needs small tweaks

body:
Provide suggestion for use after move in match arm, either using `ref` in the pattern or borrowing the moved variable:

```rust
enum Message {
    Quit,
    Move {x: String, y: String},
    Write(String),
}

fn main() {
    let msg = Message::Move { x: String::new(), y: String::new()};
    match msg {
        Message::Quit => println!("q"),
        Message::Move {x, y} => println!("m {} {}", x, y),
        Message::Write(s) => println!("w: {}", s),
    }
    if let Message::Move { x, y } = msg {
        println!("{} {}", x, y);
    }
}
```

[Has the following output](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=6e7a3f8701fc86dd18b8af88258de375):

```
error[E0382]: use of moved value
  --> src/main.rs:14:28
   |
11 |         Message::Move {x, y} => println!("m {} {}", x, y),
   |                        - value moved here
...
14 |     if let Message::Move { x, y } = msg {
   |                            ^ value used here after move
   |
   = note: move occurs because value has type `std::string::String`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait

error[E0382]: use of moved value
  --> src/main.rs:14:31
   |
11 |         Message::Move {x, y} => println!("m {} {}", x, y),
   |                           - value moved here
...
14 |     if let Message::Move { x, y } = msg {
   |                               ^ value used here after move
   |
   = note: move occurs because value has type `std::string::String`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait
```

_Reported at https://mobile.twitter.com/mountain_ghosts/status/1105168489160032257_

---

A possible output:

```
error[E0382]: use of moved value
  --> src/main.rs:14:28
   |
 9 |    match msg {
   |          --- help: consider borrowing instead of consuming here: `&msg`
...
11 |         Message::Move {x, y} => println!("m {} {}", x, y),
   |                        -
   |                        |
   |                        value moved here
   |                        help: borrow the binding to avoid consuming `msg`: `ref x`
...
14 |     if let Message::Move { x, y } = msg {
   |                            ^ value used here after move
   |
   = note: move occurs because value has type `std::string::String`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait
```
